item.title: Kodak Alaris unveils new wireless scanners with network connectivity
item.description: Kodak Alaris’ latest desktop scanners, the Kodak ScanMate i1150WN and Kodak i1190WN, offer wireless and network connectivity and are compatible with mobile apps. These features support bring-your-own-device (BYOD) policies and workplace mobility. Source: Kodak Alaris. The Kodak ScanMate i1150WN. The i1150WN and i1190WN scanners can connect through an office network or Wi-Fi, making them adaptable to various office settings. Standard drivers (TWAIN, ISIS) allow integration with new and existing business applications, streamlining the capture process and simplifying software installation.

item.title: Evernote introduces a new and improved app with a redesigned interface
item.description: Evernote has announced three updates: a brand new app, a significantly enhanced feature, and a major app redesign. As detailed in a recent blog post, the company will introduce “Scannable,” a mobile scanning app. Scannable can transform physical items like business cards and receipts into digital content that can be easily shared and acted upon. It also integrates with the ScanSnap Evernote Edition desktop scanner, enabling shared scanning across a user’s network and essentially turning it into a shared office resource.

item.title: ItSeez3D has released an updated version of its 3D scanner app for iPad
item.description: Source: itSeez3D page on the App Store. itSeez3D, a company that develops 3D scanning software, has released an updated version of their mobile scanning app, also named itSeez3D. This app, designed for use with the Occipital Structure Sensor 3D device, now allows iPads to generate lifelike, full-body 3D models. This updated app serves as a valuable tool for 3D printing, enabling the scanning of a full-color figurine in under two minutes.
